alert.note: Alert for Jasper; Marshall; Polk; Poweshiek; Tama (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 04 at 6:54PM CDT until April 04 at 7:45PM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: The National Weather Service in Des Moines has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Poweshiek County in central Iowa... East central Polk County in central Iowa... Southeastern Marshall County in central Iowa... Southwestern Tama County in central Iowa... Northern Jasper County in central Iowa... * Until 745 PM CDT. * At 654 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Mingo, or 8 miles west of Newton, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Newton around 700 PM CDT. Laurel around 710 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Haverhill, Ferguson, Gilman, Le Grand, Montour, Toledo, Tama and Meskwaki Casino. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 148 and 163. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for central Iowa.
